text: Stanley Cowell (May 5, 1941 â€“ December 17, 2020) was an American jazz pianist. He was the co-founder of the Strata-East Records label. Cowell was born in Toledo, Ohio. During the late 1980s, Cowell was part of a regular quartet led by J.J. Johnson. Cowell taught in the Music Department of the Mason Gross School of the Arts at Rutgers University in New Jersey. Cowell died at a hospital in Dover, Delaware from hypovolemic shock-related problems on December 17, 2020 at the age of 79. ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Category:American pianists Category:Musicians from Toledo, Ohio Category:Educators from Ohio Category:Deaths from hemorrhage
title: Stanley Cowell
